metadata.Title: CVE-2018-6791 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in soliduiserver/deviceserviceaction.cpp in KDE Plasma Workspace before 5.12.0. When a vfat thumbdrive that contains `` or $() in its volume label is plugged in and mounted through the device notifier, it's interpreted as a shell command, leading to a possibility of arbitrary command execution. An example of an offending volume label is "$(touch b)" -- this will create a file called b in the home folder.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-6791` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libcolorcorrect5 - 4:5.12.1-0ubuntu1
libkworkspace5-5 - 4:5.12.1-0ubuntu1
libplasma-geolocation-interface5 - 4:5.12.1-0ubuntu1
libtaskmanager6 - 4:5.12.1-0ubuntu1
libweather-ion7 - 4:5.12.1-0ubuntu1
plasma-workspace - 4:5.12.1-0ubuntu1
plasma-workspace-wayland - 4:5.12.1-0ubuntu1
sddm-theme-breeze - 4:5.12.1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: plasma-workspace package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4:5.12.1-0ubuntu1').
